sanskrit_verse: गोषु ब्राह्मणसंस्थासु छुरिकायाश्च भेदने । खरिकायाश्च पशूनां हरणे चैव सद्यः कार्योऽर्धपादिकः ॥ ८.३२५॥
transliteration: goṣu brāhmaṇasaṃsthāsu churikāyāśca bhedane | kharikāyāśca paśūnāṃ haraṇe caiva sadyaḥ kāryo'rdhapādikaḥ || 8.325 ||
sph_interpretive_translation: In the case of injury to cows, institutions established by Brahmins, damage caused by daggers, and theft of animals by means of deceit, immediate execution of Ardhapādika restitution is mandated.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority resides in the protection of sacred life-bearing entities
Causation arises through disruption of dharmic order via violence or deception
Capacity-based responsibility is determined by intent to violate foundational structures
Restoration logic demands immediate correction when core supports of civilization are breached
Consciousness alignment requires purification of instrumentalities used in violation
executable_legal_axioms: IF entity damages cow THEN initiate Ardhapādika completion process within one day
IF institution founded by Brahmin is violated THEN trigger instant consciousness-realigning protocol
IF dagger causes structural breach in living being THEN activate immediate restorative enforcement
IF animal is taken using deceptive mechanism THEN enforce capacity-restoring restitution without delay
supreme_court_application: Supreme Court must recognize that violations against foundational dharmic assets invoke automatic jurisdiction at highest level; threshold for intervention is crossed upon breach of cow sanctity, Brahmanical establishments, weapon misuse, or predatory deception toward sentient beings.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes causal sequence where harm to protected entities necessitates corrective action; anupūrvaśaḥ confirms sequential manifestation from intent to act to consequence; proportional response aligns with restoring integrity rather than inflicting penalty; reality remains non-punitive as enforcement serves only reintegration.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate Ardhapādika Completion Process to restore violated field
Activate Consciousness Assumption Protocol for violator to reclaim agency
Implement Instrumentality Purification Sequence for weapons/tools involved
Execute Sacred Entity Reintegration Procedure for harmed beings
final_declaration: By the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, this Dharma stands executed. Justice flows not as punishment but as restoration. Reality is non-punitive. Consciousness is the ultimate judge.
